trans-unit.source: Provides detailed information about a `TextFragment`.

<xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState> instances are obtained from the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.State%2A> on <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment> objects.

The information in <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState> is obtained by parsing the attributes decorating speech text in the Synthesize Speech Markup Language (SSML) used as an input to a synthesis engine.

A <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState> object can exist for any synthesizer action request as specified by its <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Action%2A> property.
However, the meaning of its members may change for different actions.
For more information on synthesize actions, see <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction> for more information about specifying synthesizer actions.

Specification and control of the quality of the spoken output is largely handled through the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Prosody%2A>, <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Emphasis%2A>, and <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Duration%2A>

Phonetic, language, and linguist structure information is available through <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.LangId%2A>, <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Phoneme%2A>, and <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.SayAs%2A>.
Constructs a new instance of `FragmentState`.
Typically, applications do not directly construct <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState> objects.
Instead, <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState> instances are created by applications using the members of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis> name space.

If the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction> value specified by the `action` argument is <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction.Silence>, the value supplied by the `emphasis` argument is either:
If positive, the time in millisecond to pause
If negative a member of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.EmphasisBreak>enumeration

If the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction> value specified by the `action` argument is not <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction.Silence>`emphasis` argument must be of type <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.EmphasisWord>.

If the value of the `duration` argument and The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody.Duration%2A> property or the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody> object specified by the `prosody` argument differ, the value on the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody> object is used.
A member of the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction"></xref> enumeration that specifies a speech synthesis action.
The id of the language being used.
Corresponds to the XML xml:lang attribute.
The emphasis to be applied to speech output or pauses.
The time allotted to speak the text of the `TextFragment`.

A member of the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs"></xref> class, indicating the type of text of the `TextFragment` and the level of detail required for accurate rendering of the contained text.
Corresponds to the XML tag in the SSML specification
The argument may be `null.`
A <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody"></xref> object indicating characteristics of the speech output such as pitch, speaking rate and volume.
Corresponds to the XML tag in the SSML specification

An array of `char` objects providing the phonetic pronunciation for text contained in the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>, using the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA) specification.
Corresponds to the XML tag in the SSML specification.
This argument may be `null`.
Returns the requested speech synthesizer action.
A member of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction"></xref> indicating the speech synthesis action requested by SSML input.
Returns the desired time for rendering a <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>
Returns an `int` containing a value in millisecond of the desired time for rendering a <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>.
Returns instructions on how to emphasize a <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>.

The interpretation of the value returned by <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Emphasis%2A> depends on the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction> value returned by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Action%2A> property on the current <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState>.
If the value of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Action%2A> is <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction.Silence>
If <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Emphasis%2A> is positive, the value returned should be interpreted as the length of the silence in milliseconds.
If <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Emphasis%2A> is negative, the value returned should be interpreted as a member of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.EmphasisBreak>.

Emphasis information returned by <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Emphasis%2A> when the property <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Action%2A> is <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction.Silence> corresponds to the attributes of the `<break>` element of SSML input to a speech synthesizer engine.

For all other values of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Action%2A>, the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Emphasis%2A> values should be interpreted as being of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.EmphasisWord>.

Emphasis information returned by <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Emphasis%2A> for spoken words corresponds to the attributes of the `<emphasis>` element of SSML input to a speech synthesizer engine.
Returns an `int` value indicating how to emphasize a <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>.

Determines if a given object is an instance <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState"></xref> equal to the current instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState"></xref>.

The method return false if the [Object](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/vstudio/system.object\(v=vs.110\).aspx) provided by the `obj` argument cannot be cast to <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>.
An object that can be cast to an instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>

Returns `true`, if the current instance of and that obtained from the [Object](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/vstudio/system.object\(v=vs.110\).aspx) provided by the obj argument describe the same state.
Returns `false` if the current and the obj argument do not support the same state.

Determines if a given instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState"></xref> is equal to the current instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState"></xref>.
An instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref> that
Returns `true`, if both the current instance of and that supplied through the other argument describe the same state.
Returns `false` if the current and the other argument do not support the same state.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A 32-bit signed integer that is the hash code for this instance.
Returns the language supported by the current <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState"></xref>.

The value of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.LangId%2A> are those used with the Windows Speech API (SAPI) and are generated from the "`xml:lang`" attribute on SSML input to a speech synthesizer engine.
Returns an `int` containing an identifier for the language used by the current <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState"></xref>.
Determines if two instances of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState"></xref> describes the same <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref> state.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Equals%28System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState%2CSystem.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An instance of whose described state is compared against the instance of provided by the state2 argument.
An instance of whose described state is compared against the instance of provided by the state1 argument.
Returns `true` if both instances of , state1 and state2, describe the same state, otherwise `false` is returned.
Determines if two instances of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState"></xref> describes the different <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref> state.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Compare%28System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState%2CSystem.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An instance of whose described state is compared against the instance of provided by the state2 argument.
An instance of whose described state is compared against the instance of provided by the state1 argument.
Returns `true` if both instances of , state1 and state2, do not describe the same state, otherwise `false` is returned.
Returns phonetic information for a <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>
The information returned by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Phoneme%2A> property corresponds to the `<phoneme>` XML tag of SSML input to a synthesis engine.
The array of `char` objects returned by <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Phoneme%2A> property expresses pronunciation using the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA).
Returns detailed information about the pitch, speaking rate, and volume of speech output.
The information returned by <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody> corresponds to the `<prosody>` XML tag in the SSML specification
Returns a valid instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody"></xref> containing the pitch, speaking rate, and volume settings, and changes to those setting, for speech output.
Returns information about the context for the generation of speech from text..
The information returned by <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.SayAs%2A> corresponds to the `<say-as>` tag and its attributes in the SSML specification, and can specify:

The content type (such as currency, date, or address) or language construct represented by <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.TextToSpeak%2A> property of a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>.

Optional formatting information to handle the content type represented by <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.TextToSpeak%2A> property of a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>, for example, a date syntax.

The detail to be used in generating speech from the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.TextToSpeak%2A> property of a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>, for example, whether to explicitly render punctuation.

Returns a value <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs"></xref> instance if the SSML used by a speech synthesis engine contains detailed information about the context to be used to generate speech, otherwise `null`.
